subject: A THOROUGH AND COMPLETE SEARCH
verse: Search me, O God, and know my heart; test me and know my thoughts. Point out anything in me that offends You, and lead me along the path of ever- lasting life. (Psalm 139:23-24)
reflection: Sometimes we think we see the whole picture, but in reality we need someone to help us see those things we cannot see. Oftentimes in my prayers, I ask Jesus to reveal those things in me that are unpleasing in His sight, those things I cannot see. It is important to me that my thoughts and actions are pleasing in His sight. Jesus alone can test our thoughts and shape our heart to look like His.
prayer: Holy God, open our eyes to see ourselves as You see us, and grant us the humility to seek Your guidance in revealing our hidden faults. Shape our hearts and minds to reflect Your character, that we may live in a way that is pleasing to You. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170936c45d4b564b
subject   : Subject: A THOROUGH AND COMPLETE SEARCH (3-1-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 29 Feb 2020 18:08:31 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
Today’s Verse:
Search me, O God, and know my heart; test me and
know my thoughts. Point out anything in me that
offends You, and lead me along the path of ever-
lasting life. (Ps. 139:23-24)

Today’s Reflection:
Sometimes we think we see the whole picture, but in
reality we need someone to help us see those things
we cannot see. Oftentimes in my prayers, I ask Jesus
to reveal those things in me that are unpleasing in His
sight, those things I cannot see. It is important to me
that my thoughts and actions are pleasing in His sight.
Jesus alone can test our thoughts and shape our
heart to look like His.
Pastor Al

subject: TIME TO REJOICE
verse: This is the day that the Lord has made. Let us  rejoice and be glad in it! (Psalm 118:24)
reflection:
Wouldn’t be great if we could feel enthusiastic every
day?
I think we’ve all had days that we did not feel
like rejoicing. Our mood was down, our situation was
out of hand, and our sorrow or guilt was overwhelming.
When you don’t feel like rejoicing. Tell God how you
truly feel. You will find that God will give you some thing to rejoice about. God has given you this day to live and serve Him-be glad!
prayer: Gracious God, even when our hearts are heavy and we struggle to find joy, help us to be honest with You about our feelings and trust that You will reveal reasons to rejoice. May we embrace each day as a gift from You, finding purpose and gladness in serving You. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17098a0c16f8fc2c
subject   : Subject: TIME TO REJOICE (3-2-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 1 Mar 2020 18:23:57 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*This is the day that the Lord has made. Let us *

*rejoice **and be glad in it! *(Ps. 118:24)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Wouldn’t be great if we could feel enthusiastic every

day? I think we’ve all had days that we did not feel

like rejoicing. Our mood was down, our situation was

out of hand, and our sorrow or guilt was overwhelming.

When you don’t feel like rejoicing. Tell God how you

truly feel. You will find that God will give you some-

thing to rejoice about*. God has given you* *this day to *

*live and serve Him—be glad!*

* Pastor Al*

subject: PURE UNQUESTIONABLE HUMILITY
verse: He must increase, but I must decrease. (John 3:30)
reflection:
John’s willingness to decrease in importance shows unusual humility.
Pastor, (yes pastors) and other Christian leaders can be tempted to focus more on the success of their ministries than on Christ. Beware of those who put more emphasis on on their own achievements than on God’s Kingdom. If you find that you have a problem with pride, pray this prayer. Jesus, release me from all personal ambitions and selfish motives.
prayer: Lord Jesus, help us to emulate John's humility and decrease our own importance so that You may increase in our lives and ministries. Release us from personal ambitions and selfish motives, focusing our hearts solely on advancing Your Kingdom rather than our own achievements. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1709de3503ca6a45
subject   : Subject: PURE UNQUESTIONABLE HUMILITY (3-3-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 2 Mar 2020 18:54:45 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*He must increase, but I must decrease. *(Jn. 3:30)



*Today’s Reflection:*

John’s willingness to decrease *in* importance shows unusual humility.
Pastor, (yes pastors) and other Christian leaders can be tempted to focus
more on the success of their ministries than on Christ. Beware of those who
put more emphasis on on their own achievements than on God’s Kingdom. If
you find

that you have a problem with pride, pray this prayer.

*Jesus, release me from all personal ambitions and selfish **motives.*

* Pastor Al *

subject: AMAZING PRAYER!
verse:
Ask, and it shall be given to you; seek, and you shall find;
knock, and it shall be opened to you. (Matthew 7:7)
reflection:
I believe that miracles happen every day, and Jesus knows what I need before I make my requests, BUT I’m still required to pray.
Have you ever wondered why? It is to open ourselves up to a personal relationship with the Savior. As I make bold requests from the Lord, I boldly receive His abundance and provisions for family, friends, and myself. So why don't we all come boldly to the throne of grace each morning?
prayer: Almighty God, open our hearts to seek You daily in prayer, deepening our relationship with You and boldly receiving Your abundant provisions. Help us to approach Your throne of grace with confidence, knowing that You hear us and desire to bless us and those we love. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170a28d144931afa
subject   : Subject: AMAZING PRAYER! (3-4-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 3 Mar 2020 16:38:40 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Ask, and it shall be given to you; seek, and you shall*

*find; knock, and it shall be opened to you. *(Mat. 7:7)



*Today’s Reflection:*

I believe that miracles happen every day, and Jesus knows what I need
before I make my requests, BUT

I’m still required to pray. Have you ever wondered

why? It is to open ourselves up to a personal relationship with the Savior.
As I make bold requests from the Lord,

I boldly receive His abundance and provisions for family, friends, and
myself. *So why don't we all c**ome boldly to **the throne of grace each
morning?*

* Pastor Al*

subject: THE HEAVENLY BENEFITS
verse: You will show me the way of life, granting me the joy of Your presence and the pleasures of living with You forever. (Psalm 16:11)
reflection:
The joys and benefits of a life lived in companion ship with God are beyond human comprehension. And the greatest thing of all is, these benefits are now and forever.
I think that to often we read verses and don’t stop and really think about what the verse has really revealed. So let’s give this some time to soak in. What are the benefits?
I believe He is offering a structure, open to
heaven, framing our pathway home in a way that adds clarity, beauty and a hint of greatness. But He still allows room for natural growth already in progress. It’s all about the on-the-way-there moments. Is Jesus smiling down on you today and saying, Thanks For Following Me!
prayer: Loving God, we thank You for the incomprehensible joys and benefits of walking with You, both now and for eternity. Help us to fully appreciate Your presence in our lives, recognizing the beauty and clarity You bring to our journey as we follow Jesus. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170a81141baf431f
subject   : Subject: THE HEAVENLY BENEFITS (3-5-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 4 Mar 2020 18:21:08 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*You will show me the way of life, granting me the joy **of Your presence
and the pleasures of living with You **forever. *(Ps. 16:11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The joys and benefits of a life lived in companion-

ship with God are beyond human comprehension. And the greatest thing of all
is, these benefits are now and forever. I think that to often we read
verses and don’t stop and really think about what the verse has really
revealed. So let’s give this some time to soak in. What are the benefits? I
believe He is offering a structure, open to

heaven, framing our pathway home in a way that adds clarity, beauty and a
hint of greatness. *But *

He still allows room for natural growth already in progress. It’s all about
the on-the-way-there moments. *Is Jesus **smiling down on you today and
saying, Thanks For **Following Me**!*

*Pastor Al*

subject: LIVING IN READINESS
verse: Be dressed for service. . . . Be like people waiting for  the master to come home. (Luke 12:35—36)
reflection: From the context of this passage, it’s obvious “dressed” doesn’t mean wearing an apron at all times or dressing in what used to be called our “Sunday best” in case Jesus returns before our next breath. But it seems clear He meant it to include anytime He calls on us, not just when He calls us home. Let us spend time today considering how we can be royal-ready for whatever He requires.
prayer: Holy God, help us to be prepared in spirit and action for Your call at any moment, living with purpose and readiness to serve You. May we clothe ourselves in righteousness and be ever-vigilant for opportunities to fulfill Your will. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170ad64275a6de11
subject   : Subject: LIVING IN READINESS (3-6-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 5 Mar 2020 19:09:47 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Be dressed for service. . . . Be like people waiting for *

*t**he master to come home. *(Lk. 12:35—36)



*Today’s Reflection:*

From the context of this passage, it’s obvious “dressed”

doesn’t mean wearing an apron at all times *or* dressing

in what used to be called our “Sunday best” in case Jesus

returns before our next breath. But it seems clear He

meant it to include anytime He calls on us, not just when

He calls us home. *Let us spend time today*

*considering how we can be royal-ready for what**ever *

*He requires.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: HONEST EVALUATION
verse: Two men went up to the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector. The Pharisee stood by himself and prayed, “God I thank You that I am not like other people—robbers, evildoers, adulterers—or even like this tax-collector. (Luke 18:10-11)
reflection:
Like the pharisee, we can be influenced by mixed
emotions in our daily lives: pride, fear, winning the praise of people, or a desire to control. We can often do the right things for the wrong reasons. Jesus challenges us to go deeper. To make choices motivated by trust and love. At times, He will encourage us to step forward boldly. Other times He will call us to step back and rest. Both actions require trust and an honest evaluation of our selves.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to examine our hearts and motivations, that we may act from a place of genuine trust and love rather than pride or fear. Guide us to discern when to step forward boldly and when to rest, always seeking to align our choices with Your will. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170b249f5469e3fd
subject   : Subject: HONEST EVALUATION (3-7-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 6 Mar 2020 17:59:16 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Two men went up to the temple to pray, one a Pharisee **and the other a
tax collector. The Pharisee stood by **himself and prayed, “God I thank You
that I am not **like other people—robbers, evildoers, adulterers—or **even
like this tax-collector. *(Lk. 18:10-11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Like the pharisee, we can be influenced by mixed

emotions in our daily lives: pride, fear, winning

the praise of people, or a desire to control. We can often do the
*right *things
for the *wrong *reasons. Jesus challenges us to go deeper. To make choices
motivated by trust and love. At times, He will encourage us to step forward
boldly. Other times He will call us to step back and rest. *Both actions
require trust and an honest evaluation of our-*

*selves.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: NEVER FEAR
verse: Jesus asked Simon Peter, “. . . Do you love me  More than these?” (John 21:15)
reflection:
Jesus’s faithful, unchanging nature is a rock-sold
truth we can count on. When Jesus invites us by
saying, “follow me,” He is also saying, “you can
count on Me. The road may be treacherous, but
I’ll keep you safe. I’ll light the way for you, and
you can rely on my strength. I don’t mind carrying
you.
And I don’t get distracted, or consumed by
other issues, or relax my grip on you.”
Remember Jesus has promised to never leave you or forsake you-What are your vows to Him?
prayer: Faithful God, as we follow Jesus, strengthen our resolve to remain steadfast in our commitment to Him, just as He is unfailingly devoted to us. Help us to trust in Your guiding light and unwavering support, even when the path seems uncertain. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170b765ea2912ae6
subject   : Subject: NEVER FEAR (3-8-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 7 Mar 2020 17:47:55 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Jesus asked Simon Peter, “. . . Do you love me *

*More than these?” *(Jn. 21:15)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus’s faithful, unchanging nature is a rock-sold

truth we can count on. When Jesus invites us by

saying, “follow me,” He is also saying, “you can

count on Me. The road may be treacherous, but

I’ll keep you safe. I’ll light the way for you, and

you can rely on my strength. I don’t mind carrying

you. And I don’t get distracted, or consumed by

other issues, or relax my grip on you.”

*Remember Jesus has promised to never leave you **or forsake you—What are
your vows to Him?*

* Pastor Al*

subject: LOVE FOR ALL
verse:
Teachers of the religious law asked . . . “Why does He eat with tax collectors and sinners?” When  Jesus heard this, He told them, “Those who are well don’t need a doctor, but the sick do need one.
(Mark 2:16-17)
reflection:
Jesus spent time with whoever needed or wanted
to hear the message-poor, rich, bad, and good.
We too, must befriend those who need Christ,
even if they do not seem to be ideal companions.
Are there people you are neglecting because of
their reputation? They may be the ones who most
need to hear and see the message of Christ’s love in and from you. Are you trying the “get a grip” instead of resting in the grip of Jesus.
prayer: Loving God, help us to follow Jesus' example by embracing all people with compassion, regardless of their status or reputation. May we rest in Your loving embrace and extend that same unconditional love to those around us who need to experience Your grace. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170c185b6c89812b
subject   : Subject: LOVE FOR ALL (3-10-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 9 Mar 2020 17:58:51 -0500

*Today’s Verse:*

*Teachers of the religious law asked . . . “Why does*

*He eat with tax collectors and sinners?” When *

*Jesus heard this, He told them, “Those who are*

*well don’t need a doctor, but the sick do need one.*

(Mk. 2:16-17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus spent time with whoever needed or wanted

to hear the message—poor, rich, bad, and good.

We too, must befriend those who need Christ,

even if they do not seem to be ideal companions.

Are there people you are neglecting because of

their reputation? They may be the ones who most

need to hear and see the message of Christ’s love

in and from you. *Are you trying the “get a grip” instead **of resting* *in
the grip of Jesus.*

*Pastor Al*

subject: GIVING HIM HUMBLE THANKS
verse: Sing and make music from your hear to the Lord always giving thanks to God the Father for every- thing, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. (Ephesians 5:19-20)
reflection: When you feel down, you may find it difficult to give thanks. But take heart-in all things God works for our good if we love him and are called by Him (Romans 8:28). Thank God not for your problems, but for the strength He is building in you through the difficult experiences in your life. You can be sure that God’s perfect love will see your through.
prayer: Holy God, we thank You not for our trials, but for the strength You are cultivating within us through life's challenges. Help us to trust in Your perfect love and guidance, knowing that You are working all things for our good. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170c6a7bacb2626e
subject   : Subject: GIVING HIM HUMBLE THANKS (3-11-2020)

to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 10 Mar 2020 17:54:06 -0500

Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Sing and make music from your hear to the Lord*

*always **giving thanks to God the Father for every-*

*thing, in the **name of our Lord Jesus Christ.*

(Eph. 5:19-20)


*Today’s Reflection:*

When you feel down, you may find it difficult to

give thanks. *But *take heart—in all things God works

for our good if we love him and are called by Him

(Ro. 8:28). Thank God not for your problems, but

for the strength He is building in you through the

difficult experiences in your life. *You can be **sure *

*that **God’s perfect love will see your through.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: BEING ONE WITH JESUS
verse:
My sheep know my voice; I know them and they follow me.
I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish; no one will snatch them out of my hand. (John 10:27, 28)
reflection:
Jesus has promised an eternal home to those who become one with Him. A place where we can live within His eternal glory forever. A place where no one can harm us. A place where no one can steal us from the safety of His hand. We have been adopted into a kingdom beyond anything we have
ever dreamed possible, where hope and power and love reign. And we need never go hungry or fear again.
prayer: Eternal God, thank You for the promise of an everlasting home in Your glorious kingdom, where we will dwell secure in Your presence, free from harm and filled with hope, power, and love. May we cling to this assurance as we journey through life, trusting in Your unfailing protection and provision. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170cbef8523026de
subject   : Subject: BEING ONE WITH JESUS (3-12-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 11 Mar 2020 18:30:37 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse: *

*My sheep know my voice; I know them and they follow **me. I give them
eternal life, and they shall never perish; **no one will snatch them out of
my hand. *(Jn. 10:27, 28)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus has promised an eternal home to those who become one with Him. A
place where we can live within His eternal glory forever. A place where

no one can harm us. A place where no one can steal us from the safety of
His hand. We have been

adopted into a kingdom beyond anything we have

ever dreamed possible, where hope and power and love reign. *And we need
never go hungry or fear again.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: A LOOSE TONGUE
verse:
The tongue is a flame of fire. It is full of wickedness that can ruin your whole life. It can turn the entire course of your whole life into a blazing flame of destruction, for it is set on fire by hell itself.
(James 3:6)
reflection: James says, the source of the wicked tongue comes from hell itself. Satan uses the tongue to divide people and pit themselves against one another. Idle and hateful words are damaging because they spread destruction quickly, and no one can stop the results once they are spoken. We dare not be careless with what we say, thinking we can apologize latter, because even if we do, the scares remain. Before we speak remember words are like fire-you can neither control or reverse the damage they can do.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to guard our tongues and speak with wisdom and kindness, recognizing the power of our words to build up or tear down. May we be mindful of the lasting impact of our speech and use it to spread love and unity rather than division and destruction. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170d0f637af35342
subject   : Subject: A LOOSE TONGUE (3-13-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 12 Mar 2020 17:56:02 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The tongue is a flame of fire. It is full of wickedness*

*that can ruin your whole life. It can turn the entire*

*course of your whole life into a blazing flame of*

*destruction, for it is set on fire by hell itself.*

(Jm. 3:6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

James says, the source of the wicked tongue comes from hell itself. *Satan
*uses the tongue to divide people and pit themselves against one another.
Idle and hateful words are damaging because they spread destruction
quickly, and no one can stop the results once they are spoken. We dare not
be careless with what we say, thinking we can apologize latter, because
even if we do, the scares remain. *Before **we speak* *remember words are
like fire—you **can neither* *control or reverse the damage they **can do.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: THE DIVIDING LINE
verse: I know your deeds, that they are neither cold nor hot. I wish you were one or the other! So, because you are lukewarm—neither hot nor cold—I am about to spit you out of my mouth. (Revelation 3:15-16)
reflection: Today we see lines everywhere. They are in parking lots, at intersections, baseball diamonds, basketball courts, and football fields. Lines can be very important. They help us know where we stand. Jesus too, drew a line when He called those from the multitude to follow Him. Jesus’ words make a very perfect line: either you are for Christ or you are against Him. That same line exists today. We must decide on which side of the line we will stand. There is no middle ground with the Lord. If fact, for those who try, it makes Him sick to His stomach. “He will spit them out.” A lot of people want to serve God, BUT only on an advisory capacity.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to stand firmly on Your side of the line, committing ourselves fully to following Jesus without hesitation or compromise. May we serve You wholeheartedly, not merely as advisors but as devoted disciples. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170d619ddc47ab4d
subject   : Subject: THE DIVIDING LINE (3-14-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 13 Mar 2020 17:53:04 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*I know your deeds, that they are neither cold nor hot. I **wish you were
one or the other! So, because you are **lukewarm—neither hot nor cold—I am
about to spit you **out of my mouth. *(Rev. 3:15-16)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Today we see lines everywhere. They are in parking lots, at intersections,
baseball diamonds, basketball courts, and football fields. Lines can

be very important. They help us know where we stand. Jesus too, drew a line
when He called those from the multitude to follow Him. Jesus’ words make a
very perfect line: either you are for Christ or you are against Him. That
same line exists today. We must decide on which side of the line

we will stand. There is no middle ground with the Lord. If fact, for those who
try, it makes Him sick to His stomach. “He will spit them out.”

*A lot of people want to serve God, BUT only*

*on an advisory capacity. *
* Pastor Al*

subject: A FAITHFUL SHEPHERD
verse: He call’s His own sheep by name and leads them out. After He has gather His own flock, He walks ahead of them, and they follow Him because they know His voice. (John 10:3-4)
reflection:
Everything changes when we regard Jesus as our shepherd. He protect, guides, and provides for us. Knowing that we don’t need to fend for ourselves floods us with a sense of security, thus we find peace. Read Psalm 23 as a prayer to Jesus.
Verses one and two might sound like this: ”Jesus, you’re my Shepherd and provide everything I need. Thanks for letting me rest in green meadows and leading me beside peaceful streams.
prayer: Lord Jesus, as our Good Shepherd, we thank you for your constant protection, guidance, and provision in our lives. Help us to find true peace and security in your loving care, resting in the green meadows and peaceful streams of your presence. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170db6f4693a4c91
subject   : Subject: A FAITHFUL SHEPHERD (3-15-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 14 Mar 2020 18:44:28 -0500

===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*He call’s His own sheep by name and leads them out. **After He has gather
His own flock, He walks ahead **of them, and they follow Him because they
know His **voice. *Jn. 10:3—4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Everything changes when we regard Jesus as our shepherd. He protect,
guides, and provides for us. Knowing that we don’t need to fend for
ourselves floods us with a sense of security, thus we find peace. Read Ps.
23 as a prayer to Jesus. Verses one and two might sound like this: ”
*Jesus, **you’re my *

*Shepherd and provide everything I need.*

*Thanks **for letting me rest in green meadows and leading **me beside
peaceful streams.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: GENEROSITY AND DILIGENCE
verse: Give generously, for your gifts will return to you latter. Divide your gifts among many, for you do not know what risks might lie ahead.  (Ecclesiastes 11:1-2)
reflection:
In these verses Solomon summarizes that life involves both risk and opportunity. Because life has no guarantees, we must be prepared. “Give generously,” because life has opportunities and we must seize them. Solomon does not support a stingy, despairing attitude. Just because life is
uncertain does not mean we should do nothing. We need a spirit of trust and adventure, facing life’ risk and opportunities with God-directed enthusiasm and faith. Waiting for perfect conditions will mean inactivity.
prayer: Almighty God, grant us the wisdom to embrace life's uncertainties with faith and courage, seizing opportunities to give generously and act boldly in Your name. Help us trust in Your providence as we face both risks and rewards, never allowing fear to hinder our service to You and others. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170e0552e3c9c921
subject   : Subject: GENEROSITY AND DILIGENCE (3-16-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 15 Mar 2020 17:34:04 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Give generously, for your gifts will return to you latter. **Divide your
gifts among many, for you do not know **what risks might lie ahead. *

(Eccl. 11:1-2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In these verses Solomon summarizes that life involves both risk and
opportunity. Because life has no guarantees, we must be prepared. “Give
generously,” because life has opportunities and

we must seize them. Solomon does not support

a stingy, despairing attitude. Just because life is

uncertain does not mean we should do nothing.

We need a spirit of trust and adventure, facing

life’ risk and opportunities with God-directed enthusiasm and faith. *Waiting
for perfect conditions will mean inactivity.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: PRACTICING CHRIST-LIKENESS
verse: Be still, and know that I am God. (Psalm 46:10) Be holy because I am holy. (Leviticus 11:46)
reflection:
The most important use of our day is to practice being like Jesus.
Even when we have-to-deal with a difficult person OR when we receive bad news. Every-day we can expect to encounter plenty of opportunities to choose between behaving like Christ would, and acting on the basis of our natural instincts. In those moments, what we do will reflect who we are becoming. AND that is much more important than crossing off every item on the longest to-do list.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to prioritize becoming more like Jesus in our daily lives, especially when faced with challenging people or situations. May our actions reflect Your love and grace, shaping us into the image of Christ with each choice we make. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170e5eb294aa9a9b

===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Be still, and know that I am God. *(Ps. 46:10)

*Be holy because I am holy. *(Lev. 11:46)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The most important use of our day is to practice being like Jesus. *Even*
when we have-to-deal with a difficult person *OR *when we receive bad news.
Every-day we can expect to encounter plenty of opportunities to choose
between behaving like Christ would, and acting on the basis of our natural
instincts. In those moments, what we do *will* reflect who we are
becoming. *AND
that is much more important **than crossing off every item on the longest
to-do list.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: INVITED TO BE REBORN
verse:
You are among those who have been called to belong to Jesus Christ, dear friends in Rome.  God loves you dearly, and He has called you  to be His very own people.
May grace and  peace be yours from God our Father and the  Lord Jesus Christ. (Romans 1:6-7)
reflection:
Paul says that those who become Christians are
invited by Jesus to (1) belong to God’s family
and (2) be His very own people. What-a-wonderful
expression of what it means to be a Christian! In
being reborn into God’s family we have the great est experience of love and the greatest inheritance.
Because of all that God has done for us, we should strive to be His holy people.
prayer: Holy God, we thank You for inviting us into Your family and making us Your own people through Jesus Christ. Help us to live as Your holy people, embracing the love and inheritance You have given us. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verses:*

*You are among those who have been called to belong **to Jesus Christ, dear
friends in Rome. *

*God loves you **dearly, and He has called you *

*to be His very own **people. May grace and *

*peace be yours from God **our Father and the *

*Lord Jesus Christ. *(Ro. 1:6-7)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Paul says that those who become Christians are

invited by Jesus to (1) belong to God’s family

and (2) be His very own people. *What-a-wonderful*

expression of what it means to be a Christian! In

being reborn into God’s family we have the great-

est experience of love and the greatest inheritance.

*Because of all that God has done for us, we *

*should strive to be His holy people. *

*Pastor Sather*

subject: HAVING A PURPOSE
verse: The Lord has made everything for His own purpose. (Proverbs 14:4)
reflection:
Jesus’s purpose on earth was to preach the gospel,
heal the sick and brokenhearted, and to set the
captives free. He had an appointed time to work
on earth before He fulfilled His other purpose,
which was dying to save us. When He left, Jesus
purposed us with continuing the work He started
on earth with each of us working as a sole example
bring hope, beauty, and truth to the world. Like
the bees that spread pollen, we are meant to spread
the love of Jesus. When we seek Jesus, He helps us to fulfill our purpose in our jobs, churches, families, and communities.
prayer: Lord Jesus, help us to continue Your work on earth by spreading Your love and bringing hope, beauty, and truth to the world. Guide us in fulfilling our purpose in our jobs, churches, families, and communities, as we seek to follow Your example. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170effb9846585d5
subject   : Subject: HAVING A PURPOSE (3-19-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 18 Mar 2020 18:30:08 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord has made everything for His own purpose. *(Pro. 14:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus’s purpose on earth was to preach the gospel,

heal the sick and brokenhearted, and to set the

captives free. He had an appointed time to work

on earth before He fulfilled His other purpose,

which was dying to save us. *When He left*, Jesus

purposed us with continuing the work He started

on earth with each of us working *as a sole example*

bring hope, beauty, and truth to the world. Like

the bees that spread pollen, we are meant to spread

the love of Jesus. When we seek Jesus, *He helps*

*us to fulfill our purpose in our jobs, churches,*

*families, and communities.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: seeking true security
verse:
The rich think of their wealth as an impregnable  defense, they imagine it is a high wall of safety.
(Psalm 18:11)
reflection:
In imagining that their wealth is their strongest
defense, rich people are sadly mistaken. Money
cannot provide safety-there are to many ways
for it to lose its power. The Government may
cease to back it; thieves may steal it; inflation
may rob it of its value. But God never loses His
power.
He is always dependable. Where do you
look for your security and safety-in uncertain wealth OR God who is always faithful?
prayer: Almighty God, help us to place our trust in Your unfailing power and faithfulness rather than in the fleeting security of earthly riches. May we find true safety and peace in Your eternal love and protection. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170f8a546c67b584
subject   : Subject: seeking true security (3-20-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 20 Mar 2020 10:52:26 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The rich think of their wealth as an impregnable *

*defense, they imagine it is a high wall of safety.*

(Ps. 18:11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In imagining that their wealth is their strongest

defense, rich people are sadly mistaken. Money

cannot provide safety—there are to many ways

for it to lose its power. The Government may

cease to back it; thieves may steal it; inflation

may rob it of its value. But God never loses His

power. He is always dependable. Where do you

look for your security and safety—*in uncertain*

*wealth OR God who is always faithful?*

* Pastor Sather *


(sorry for the delay I was having computer problems)

subject: ARE YOUR PRAYERS SINCERE?
verse:
Your prayers and your compassionate gifts to the poor have not gone unnoticed by God!
(Acts 10:4)
reflection:
God saw Cornelius’s sincere faith. His prayers
and his generous giving had not gone unnoticed
by God. God answers the sincere prayers of those
who seek Him by sending the right person or the
right information at the right time. Jesus’s life
was consumed with prayer and compassionate
acts.
Can the same be said about yours? [To many people offer God prayer with claw marks all over them!]
prayer: Gracious God, help us to cultivate a life of sincere prayer and compassionate acts, following the example of Jesus and Cornelius. May our faith be evident through our generosity and devotion, trusting that You hear and answer the prayers of those who earnestly seek You. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Your prayers and your compassionate gifts to*

*the poor have not gone unnoticed by God!*

(Acts 10:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God saw Cornelius’s sincere faith. His prayers

and his generous giving had not gone unnoticed

by God. God answers the sincere prayers of those

who seek Him by sending the right person or the

right information at the right time. Jesus’s life

was consumed with prayer and compassionate

acts. *Can the same be said about yours?*

*[To many people offer God prayer with claw marks*

*all over them!**] *

*Pastor Sather*

subject: TODAY'S CHALLENGE
verse: For I want you to understand what really matters, so that you may live pure and blameless lives until Christ  returns. (Philippians 1:10 NLT)
reflection:
Paul prayed that the Philippian believers would have the ability to differentiate between right and wrong, good and bad, vital and trivial. We need to pray for moral discernment so we can maintain our Christian morals and values. Hebrews 5:14 emphasizes the need of discernment. We need to remember to live each day as if this is the day Christ will return.
Let us not forget to pray every day for the courageous health care workers and nursing home attendants
prayer: Holy God, grant us the wisdom to discern right from wrong and the strength to uphold our Christian values in all we do. May we live each day with purpose, remembering those who care for the sick and vulnerable, as we await Christ's return. (AI)

we can maintain our Christian morals

and values. Heb. 5:14 emphasizes the need of discernment. *We need to

*this is the day Christ will return.*


*Let us not forget to pray every day for the courageous **health care

subject: THERE'S FORGIVENESS

prayer: Merciful God, we thank You for Your boundless grace and forgiveness that offers hope even in our darkest moments. Help us to turn to You in times of struggle and fear, knowing that Your love and mercy await our return. (AI)

He stands with His arms outstretched and extended.To hold and restore you, just mercy intended.
Remember there’s forgiveness.

prayer: Faithful God, help us to turn our hearts and minds fully toward You, trusting in Your promise of eternal life and embracing the healing and fellowship You offer. May we recognize ourselves as Your temple and choose to abide in Your presence always. (AI)

subject: WOULD YOU ENLIST
verse: Pray without ceasing. (I Thessalonians 5:17)
reflection:
We are living in a difficult time, when it is very important that we truly pray without ceasing. Just how are we to do this?
Well Paul gives this advise; he says: “be joyful” and “pray without ceasing” he also says “no matter what happens, always be thankful,” for this is God’s will. It goes
without saying we cannot spend all our time on our knees, but it is possible, to have a prayerful attitude, at all times.
This attitude is built upon acknowledging our dependence, on God realizing His presence within us, and determining to obey Him fully. Then we will find it natural to pray frequently, spontaneously, short prayers. Would you enlist and become a faithful prayer warrior?
prayer: Holy God, instill in us a prayerful attitude that acknowledges our dependence on You, recognizes Your constant presence, and strengthens our resolve to obey You fully. Help us to become faithful prayer warriors, offering spontaneous and frequent prayers throughout our days, so that we may truly pray without ceasing. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1711919f6c45d6fd
subject   : Subject: WOULD YOU ENLIST (3-27-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 26 Mar 2020 18:07:44 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Pray without ceasing. *(I Thess. 5:17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We are living in a difficult time, when it is very important that we truly
pray without ceasing. Just how are we to do this? Well

Paul gives this advise; he says: “be joyful” and “pray without ceasing” he
also says “no matter what happens, always be thankful,” for this is God’s
will. It goes

without saying we cannot spend all our time on our knees, but it is
possible, to have a prayerful attitude, at all times.

This attitude is built upon acknowledging our dependence, on God realizing
His presence within us, and determining to

obey Him fully. Then we will find it natural to pray frequently,
spontaneously, short prayers.* Would you **enlist and become a faithful
prayer warrior?*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: A TRUE RELATIONSHIP
verse: Then Jesus prayed this prayer: “O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, thank for hiding the truth from those who think themselves so wise and clever, and for revealing it to the childlike. (Matthew 11:25)
reflection:
Jesus mentions two kinds of people; “the wise and cleaver” arrogant in their own knowledge-and the “childlike”-
humbly open to receive the truth of God’s Word. Are you wise in your own eyes, or do you seek the truth in childlike faith, realizing that only God holds all the answers. In the O. T. to “know” means more than knowledge. It means to have an intimate relationship.
prayer: Lord of Life, open our hearts to receive your truth with childlike faith and humility, drawing us into a deeper, more intimate relationship with you. May we set aside our own wisdom and arrogance, recognizing that true knowledge comes from knowing you. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1711dfcf630726b8
subject   : Subject: A TRUE RELATIONSHIP (3-28-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 27 Mar 2020 16:54:10 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Then Jesus prayed this prayer: “O Father, Lord of heaven **and earth,
thank for hiding the truth from those who think **themselves so **wise and
clever, and for revealing it to the **childlike. *(Mt. 11:25)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus mentions two kinds of people; “the wise and cleaver” arrogant in
their own knowledge—and the “childlike”—

humbly open to receive the truth of God’s Word. Are you wise in your own
eyes, or do you seek the truth in childlike faith,

realizing that only God holds all the answers. *In the O. T. to “know”
means more than knowledge. It **means to have an intimate relationship.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: OBEYING THE GREATEST
verse: One of the Pharisees in order to trap Jesus asked, “Teacher, which is the most important commandment in the law of Moses?” Jesus replied, “You must love  the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind. (Matthew 22:36-38)
reflection:
The Pharisee who asked this question was attempting to stump Jesus. But Jesus reminded the Pharisee, and He reminds us, that when we feel overwhelmed by
commands and rules, we can come back to the core truth.
Our God wants to be in a relationship with us. Because of Jesus, that relationship is restored. We never go wrong when we poor our hearts, souls, and minds into love for our Lord. Jesus said, “This is the greatest command.”
prayer: Loving God, help us to focus on the core truth of Your desire for relationship with us, and guide us to pour our hearts, souls, and minds into loving You above all else. May we always remember that through Jesus, our relationship with You is restored, and loving You is the greatest commandment we can follow. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 171234b00a24421f
subject   : Subject: OBEYING THE GREATEST (3-29-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 28 Mar 2020 17:37:30 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*One of the Pharisees in order to trap Jesus asked, **“Teacher, which is
the most important commandment **in the law of Moses?” Jesus replied, “You
must **love *

*the Lord your God with all your heart, with **all your soul, and with all
your mind. *(Mt. 22:36-38)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The Pharisee who asked this question was attempting to stump Jesus. But
Jesus reminded the Pharisee, and He reminds

us, that when we feel overwhelmed by

commands and rules, we can come back

to the core truth. Our God wants to be in

a relationship with us. Because of Jesus,

that relationship is restored. We never

go wrong when we poor our hearts, souls, and minds into love for our
Lord. *Jesus
said, “This is **the greatest command.”*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: GOD DEALING WITH EGYPTIAN IDOL WORSHIP
verse: “You shall have no other gods before Me. You shall not make for yourself a carved image.” (Exodus 20:3-4b)
reflection:
Read these two verses once again. Don't you think that we should be concerned? GOD DEALING WITH TODAY’S IDOL WORSHIP
In three short months just like God did with the plagues In Egypt, God has taken away everything we worship. We are known for the worship of athletes, so I will
Shut down your stadiums. We worship our musicians, I will shut down your Civic Centers. We worship actors, I will shut down the theaters. We worship money, I
will shut down the economy and crush the stock market. You don’t want to go to church and worship me, I will make it so you can’t go to church. If my people called by my name will humble them selves and pray and keep the faith, and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear them from heaven and forgive their
sins and heal their land. Maybe we don’t need a vaccine! maybe instead we should take the time to avoid the distractions of the world and have a personal revival where we focus on the only thing in the world that really matters, Jesus Christ.
prayer: Almighty God, we humbly acknowledge our misplaced worship and ask for Your forgiveness; help us turn our hearts fully toward You, finding true meaning and purpose in Jesus Christ alone. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17128a0399d59d7c

*Today's Verses:*

*“You shall have no other gods before Me. You shall not make **for yourself
a carved image.” *(Exodus 20:3-4b)


*Today's Reflection:*

Read these two verses once again. Don't you think that we should be
concerned?

GOD DEALING* WITH TODAY’S IDOL WORSHIP*

In three short months just like God did with the plagues In Egypt, God has
taken away everything we worship. We are

known for the worship of athletes, so I will

Shut down your stadiums. We worship our musicians, I will shut down your
Civic Centers. We worship actors, I will shut down the theaters. We worship
money, I

will shut down the economy and crush the stock market. You don’t want to go
to church and worship me, I will make it so

you can’t go to church. If my people

called by my name will humble them-

selves and pray and keep the faith, and turn from their wicked ways, then I

subject: PATIENCE PAYS
verse: Happy are those servants whom the master finds waiting up when he arrives. . . . he will dress himself to serve, seat them at the table as honored guests, and wait on them. (Luke 12:37)
reflection:
Jesus is asking us to be dressed and ready, like a well-trained and beloved servant anticipating our Master’s arrival. But He added more to the story from Luke 12. He said that the servants who are “Waiting up” when He arrives home, no matter
the hour, are happy and blessed. Not tired. Not exhausted.
Not impatient. Happy. Then if you notice the tables are turned. The master dresses himself to serve, seats us in a place of honor, and waits on us. I can’t imagine a more humbling
experience than having Jesus serve me in that way. Won’t that be something to write home about?
prayer: Gracious God, help us to remain vigilant and joyful as we await Your return, and grant us the humility to receive Your loving service with grateful hearts. May we always be ready to welcome You, our Master who became a servant. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1712d9342ee93b28
subject   : Subject: PATIENCE PAYS (3-31-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 30 Mar 2020 17:32:38 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Happy are those servants whom the master finds **waiting up when he
arrives. . . . he will dress him**self to serve, seat them at the table as
honored **guests, and wait on them. *(Lk. 12:37)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus is asking us to be dressed and ready, like a well-trained and beloved
servant anticipating our Master’s arrival. But He added more to the story from
Luke 12. He said that the servants who are “Waiting up” when He arrives
home, no matter

the hour, are happy and blessed. Not tired. Not exhausted. Not impatient.
Happy. Then if you notice the tables are turned. The master dresses himself
to *serve,* seats us in a place of honor, and waits on us. I can’t imagine
a more humbling

experience than having Jesus serve me in that way. *Won’t that be something
to write home **about?*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: TRUSTING IN JESUS PAYS OFF
verse: At dawn Jesus called out “Friends, have you caught any fish?” “No,” they replied. “Throw out your net on the right-hand side of the boat, and you’ll get plenty of fish!” So they did, and they couldn’t draw in the net because there were so many fish in it. (John 21:5-6)
reflection:
Give this some thought: they had been casting out their nets all night long. They were tired and ready to go home eat some breakfast and go to bed. If you read verse four, it says they didn’t even recognize who was on the beach. I can hear one
of them saying to the rest, why not we have nothing to lose. Well we know what happened, they caught so many fish they could not get them into the boat. I think that once in-a-while we need to be reminded to trust Jesus. I also think that
if we did we’d be much better off. So let us remember to ask Jesus to teach us to trust that He will provide for us.
prayer: Holy God, teach us to trust in Your provision even when we are weary and uncertain, and help us to recognize Your presence in our daily lives. May we cast our nets at Your command and be amazed by Your abundant blessings. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17132ca76ff07172
subject   : Subject: TRUSTING IN JESUS PAYS OFF (4:1-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 31 Mar 2020 17:51:02 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

At dawn Jesus called out “Friends, have you caught any fish?” “No,” they
replied. “Throw out your net on the right-hand side of the boat, and you’ll
get plenty of fish!” So they did, and they couldn’t draw in the net because
there were so many fish in it.


*Today’s Reflection:*

Give this some thought: they had been casting out their nets all night
long. They were tired and ready to go home eat some breakfast and go to
bed. If you read verse four, it says they didn’t even recognize who was on
the beach. I can hear one

of them saying to the rest, why not we have nothing to lose. Well we know
what happened, they caught so many fish they

could not get them into the boat. I think that once in-a-while we need to
be reminded to trust Jesus. I also think that

if we did we’d be much better off. *So let us remember to **ask Jesus to
teach us to trust that He will provide for us.*

* Pastor Sather*
